RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CECIL THE GREAT pressured the pace and took the nod two deep midway on the turn, dug in under steady handling leaving the turn and cleared HARLEY SIOUX in later yards. The latter ducked in leaving the gate and made contact with Gambling Fever, set a pressured pace through the backstretch but was met at the rail midway on the turn, relented in mid-stretch and just lasted for second. MY BALBOA gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn, ran evenly in the lane and just missed second. DIMELO PAPI was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, raced evenly in the stretch but pulled up lame on the clubhouse turn and was consequently euthanized. DON'T GET CAUGHTUP gave chase toward the outside, rounded the turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. GAMBLING FEVER was bumped soundly at the break then angled out to give chase, but to no avail. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Gambling Fever
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Harley Sioux
ENTRY.OWNER: Straughn William E and Thacker Daniel
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,bumped,pace inside,met mid turn,just lasted 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Cecil the Great
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,nod 2d mid turn,cleared later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE NOVEMBER 10, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE BIT OF THAT rated a short lead leaving the half mile pole, came under pressure at the rail into the turn and held on well with steady handling. FORTES gave chase toward the outside, entered the turn about the three path, eased out nearing the head of the lane and dug in to take second the final strides. TIZ THE REASON chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. PUPPYMONKEYBABY chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. SISTER'S DUTY gave chase, rounded the turn in the three and four path then flattened stride. VALID REASON gave chase outside, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Bit of That
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured rail turn,steady handling lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CALCULATED LUV gave chase inside, squeezed through at the rail for the nod entering the stretch, cleared Hot Rod Love past the eighth pole and held well under steady handling. CAJUN JOE gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and cleared second nearing mid-stretch. ADIOS COOL ARROWS was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and came along for third mid-stretch. COOLKID gave distant early chase outside, raced off the rail on the turn and improved his position in an even finish. VIBRANT FORCE chased the early pace toward mid track, raced near the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane. HOT ROD LOVE ducked in and made contact with Adios Cool Arrows leaving the gate then set a pressured pace while tapering inward, raced at the rail on the turn, was met entering the stretch and gave way. RUMORS TO BLAME gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. SUPER ROCKY gave chase from well back and toward the outside and rounded the turn in the four path.

ENTRY.NAME: Calculated Luv
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,squeezed through rail 1/8,clear past pole,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Coolkid
ENTRY.COMMENT: distant chased,off rail turn,improved position,even finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TAPIO pressured the pace through the opening quarter mile and took the nod at the five sixteenths pole, contested the edge off the rail on the turn and held well under steady stretch handling. SKY OF GOLD gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and ran evenly in the lane. WOOTDAREITIS chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn, eased out leaving the turn and finished well while gaining on the runner-up. D TACHYON chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn, eased outward leaving the turn and had little left. BIG BALLOONS set a pressured pace the opening quarter mile, was met at the five sixteenths pole and remained a close factor at the rail on the turn, but weakened into the lane. BOSEY gave chase and raced off the rail on the turn. BOP ZAPPER chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and weakened in the lane.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 10, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since May 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GARY DOING BIZ gave chase through the backstretch, entered the turn at the rail, eased four wide leaving the turn and dug in under steady handling to get up the final stride. COMIDA COMIDA chased inside through the backstretch, raced close at the rail on the turn, eased outward approaching the head of the lane and took a brief slim lead nearing mid-stretch, but was nipped under the wire. MO CO GOLD chased and raced close in the three path on the turn and dueled gamely through the stretch. ALWAYS SOMETHING was hustled to the lead and set a pressured pace inside, raced at the rail on the turn, was met past the eighth pole and flattened stride the final sixteenth. BESTLA gave chase toward the outside through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and ran evenly in the lane. INCLUDE THE BEAST gave chase outside, raced in the four and five paths on the turn, left the turn outside and flattened in the lane. AMERICA'S PRIDE gave chase and rounded the turn about the five path.

ENTRY.NAME: Comida Comida
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,close rail turn,brief lead 1/16,nipped wire

ENTRY.NAME: Include the Beast
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 10, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STYLISH PAINT saved ground on the first turn, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced close near the rail on the far turn, eased out leaving the turn and dug in to get up the final yards. DORITA'S HEART tapered in and stalked the early pace two deep, took the lead at the nine sixteenths pole and came under pressure leaving the three eighths, contested the advantage off the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was outfinished the final yards. PRACTICALLY THERE raced well back about the three path the first turn then eased out entering the backstretch, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved, raced in the four path on the far turn, angled in leaving the turn and ran evenly in the lane. BONNIE BLUETOOTH ducked out leaving the gate then saved ground, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and flattened in the lane. ONEPRETTYTHING set the early pace inside, was met approaching the nine sixteenths pole and gave chase into the backstretch, but faded past the five sixteenths pole. MARKETABILITY raced off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. CICI UNIFIED rounded the first turn about the three path and showed little response through the backstretch. SOCIAL EXCLUSION rated off the pace about the three path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole then flattened in the five path on the far turn. MISS WILD was shut off leaving the gate then steadied in traffic through the front stretch, moved to the outside into the backstretch and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Bonnie Bluetooth
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,saved ground,chased 3/8,rail far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Marketability
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Dorita's Heart
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Stylish Paint
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,close rail turn,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Practically There
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back 3p,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,4p far turn,evenly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (R aces Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SILVER RULES veered in leaving the gate then pressured the pace, dueled to even terms three wide midway on the turn and dug in under determined handling to get the nod in later yards. DREAMY SONDE set a pressured pace through the backstretch, was met at even terms nearest the rail midway on the turn, dug in gamely leaving the turn but relented the nod in later yards. CHEROKEE CASTLE chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail, angled four wide leaving the turn and dueled through the stretch for third. PHANTOM QUEEN was forced in leaving the gate and exchanged contact with Scarlet Rebel then pressured the pace, dropped back while two deep and between horses midway on the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. XANTHE was shuffled back at the break then gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the four path, moved out entering the stretch and passed rivals. DIXIE YODELER was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn, angled widest into the lane and improved her position. SCARLET REBEL was bumped inward and into Dixie Yodeler leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little further. SLEWING chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamy Sonde
ENTRY.OWNER: Pascal Lawrence J and Harding Sr Philip Arthur
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met rail mid turn,game lane,relented nod late

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Rules
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered in break,pressed pace,even terms 3p turn,nod late yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ZAP MAN rated off the pace inside on the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, dug in from the head of the lane, took the lead in later yards and drew clear nearing the wire. REMASTERED took over and moved to the inside to show the way, came under pressure nearing the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn at the rail and dug in leaving the turn but was met in later yards and flattened toward the wire. HAY DIDDLE DIDDLE raced well back in the three path the opening turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved from that point, rounded the far turn about the four path and dueled through the final sixteenth for third. AGAIN WE MEET saved ground well off the pace the first turn, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, raced two deep on the far turn and was outfinished for third the final sixteenth. FLOOR IT raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and flattened in later yards. NET WORTH came away awkwardly, bore out on the first turn and was no factor racing wide. SMOKIN SMITTY stalked off the rail, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but faded in the three path on the far turn. RUSH TO CANDY saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. RUN FOR KARL came away awkwardly and rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole but faded in the five path on the far turn. CAPT COMPLICATED showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Hay Diddle Diddle
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

ENTRY.NAME: Zap Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 1/2,close off rail turn,up late,clear wire

ENTRY.NAME: Net Worth
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,bore out 1st turn,no factor wide
